report_title: Industry Report on Pilates and Yoga Studios
executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

Pilates and yoga studios have evolved significantly, driven by digital innovation and shifting consumer preferences. Despite strengthening participation in yoga and Pilates, the emergence of lower-cost alternatives has stifled studio attendance. Online platforms, mobile applications, gyms and fitness centers have intensified competition for studios. The availability of high-quality online resources has ushered in an era where enthusiasts can easily practice from the comfort of their homes. Revenue has fallen at a CAGR of 1.7% to reach an estimated $14.7 billion leading up to 2024, when revenue will dip an expected 6.8%.

While Pilates participation rates have remained somewhat stagnant in recent years, yoga participation rates have boomed. Still, this expansion in practitioners hasn't translated to Pilates and yoga studio sales since yoga is more accessible for newcomers to pick up and maintain outside of a studio. Pilates practitioners may be more inclined to attend classes to have access to high-cost equipment like reformers and towers. To keep yoga practitioners coming back, studios have expansively appealed to niche demographics through prenatal, senior or power yoga classes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Virtual Classes Are Another Competitive Avenue For Pilates and Yoga Practitioners
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The availability of reputable fitness resources online has resulted in numerous affordable guides for practicing yoga and Pilates at home. This convenience has generated competition, drawing consumers away from traditional in-studio practices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Studios Meet More Personalized Consumer Preferences
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Seasoned practitioners crave a personalized approach to their fitness journey, preferring fitness routines curated to their unique lifestyle and goals rather than sticking to a one-size-fits-all method.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Yoga and Wellness Trends Impact Participation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Shifts in yoga practices and preferences contribute to the evolving landscape of yoga in the US. By ensuring their offerings include the most popular practices, yoga studios ensure a consistent flow of new students.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE CONSUMER DEMOGRAPHIC BASE IS EXPANDING
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Niche studios are gaining popularity for their targeted strategy, opening classes that serve specific demographics like pregnant people, children and senior citizens and by offering various yoga disciplines.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Emphasis on Health Will Motivate Yoga and Pilates Participation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US population is growing more health-conscious every year, leading to more consumers investing in pastimes that help maintain physical fitness.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Pilates Will Be Increasingly Used in Rehabilitation and Recovery
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Pilates will continue to gain popularity thanks to its low-impact nature and significant benefits for older adults and those recovering from injuries. Studios offering clinical Pilates will differentiate themselves from general fitness centers and attract a dedicated clientele seeking specialized care.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Yoga and Pilates Enthusiasts Continue to Enjoy Working Out at Home
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Pilates and yoga studios will continue to broaden their range of services to attract and retain a diverse customer base. Integrating digital and hybrid services will be a vital part of this strategy.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Future Expansion Will Depend On Older Markets
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the aging population turns more to yoga and Pilates to care for their health, greater participation in studio classes will be generated.

industry_definition: This industry comprises facilities that offer Pilates and yoga instruction to individuals or groups. Pilates is a body conditioning routine used to build

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low & Steady

opportunities: Per capita disposable income Low - steady

key_trends: Competition from virtual alternatives is heating up. Pilates and yoga practitioners can find low- or no-cost classes online via social media, YouTube or mobile applications.
A fragmented industry forces studios to appeal to local niches. Since Pilates and yoga studios struggle to differentiate themselves, they focus on building customer loyalty in a specific area.
Emerging yoga trends are diversifying the practice. Unique styles like Yin and hot yoga, along with immersive retreats, are drawing in new students seeking specialized benefits and experiences.

Pilates will be increasingly used for rehabilitation and recovery, especially beneficial for older adults and injury sufferers. Studios offering clinical Pilates will expand their market by collaborating with healthcare professionals.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes consumers between 18 and 29 who attend yoga or Pilates classes. Consumers between 18 and 29 are more drawn to yoga since classes are typically less expensive than Pilates. Constraints on disposable income prevent more people in this demographic from attending yoga and Pilates classes.

This segment includes consumers aged 30 to 49 that attend yoga or Pilates classes. Practitioners in this age group generate the most sales for Pilates and yoga studios since they have more disposable income than their younger counterparts and are less physically constrained than older consumers. Health-consciousness trends have flourished among this age group and studios have appealed to this market accordingly.

This segment includes consumers aged 50 and older who attend yoga or Pilates classes. Consumers in this age group are attracted to yoga's many health benefits, like improving symptoms related to chronic back pain, depression, diabetes and menopause. Studios appeal to this demographic by offering classes with modifications, blocks and other props to assist with yoga poses. COVID-19 and associated social distancing guidelines have hindered this market in recent years.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes sales from yoga classes, with the current most popular types of yoga being yin and hot yoga.
This segment includes sales from Pilates classes, which focus on building lean muscle and strength while improving flexibility and agility.
This segment includes apparel, equipment, accessories and food and beverage sales.
This segment includes apparel, equipment, accessories and food and beverage sales.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Health and fitness clubs that provide many fitness classes (including yoga and Pilates) are excluded from the industry and considered a source of external competition. Fitness clubs appeal to consumers based on convenience, affordability and variety. Demand from gym, health and fitness clubs significantly impacts on competition for Pilates and yoga studios.

business_locations.location_description: Health Trends in the West Drive Consumers to Yoga and Pilates Classes
A Populated Southeast Brings Studios to the Region
Urban Density in the Mid-Atlantic Attracts Pilates and Yoga Studios

regulations_points.regulation_description: Pilates and yoga studios must adhere to regulations that govern membership contracts, giving members the right to cancel within three business days of signing. This protects consumers from rushed decisions or misleading sales tactics.

The Pilates Method Alliance established the first national-level certification program for Pilates. The program requires that instructors be at least 18 years of age and complete 450 hours of training to be certified. Training programs are similar for yoga instructors.

basis_points.basis_description: Pilates and yoga practitioners can find low- or no-cost classes online via social media, YouTube, etc.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Pilates and Yoga Studios Struggle to Differentiate Themselves
concentration_points.concentration_description: Studios are typically small and independently owned and cater to a market niche of local consumers.
The rise of virtual classes during COVID-19 has lingered on consumers' workout habits, contributing to mounting competition.

FAQs.question: What is the National Association for Health and Fitness (NAHF)?
FAQs.answer: The National Association for Health and Fitness (NAHF) is a nonprofit organization that promotes physical fitness and sports and supports governors' and state councils on these topics. The association produces newsletters on strategies and successful approaches to increasing physical activity and improving health.

FAQs.question: What is Yoga Alliance?
FAQs.answer: Yoga Alliance, a nonprofit organization, promotes yoga to the public and supports industry professionals. It sets standards for and accredits yoga teacher training programs. The organization also provides educational resources to enhance the practice and teaching of yoga. Its initiatives help maintain the integrity and quality of yoga instruction, ensuring practitioners receive high-quality training.

FAQs.question: How can offering diverse classes increase revenue?
FAQs.answer: Offering a diverse range of classes, such as classes for the elderly, can increase revenue.

FAQs.question: How can promoting bundle packages help ensure stable demand?
FAQs.answer: Promoting bundle packages and other products to increase retention and community building can ensure stable demand for operators.

FAQs.question: How can locating in high-density areas benefit industry operators?
FAQs.answer: Locating in high-density areas ensures a steady stream of demand for industry operators.

FAQs.question: How can acquisitions benefit companies in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Acquisitions can help increase scale and enhance segment portfolios to diversify revenue streams.

FAQs.question: How can automating point-of-sale systems reduce labor costs?
FAQs.answer: Automating point-of-sale systems either entirely or for a fraction of transactions minimizes reliance on labor.

FAQs.question: How can developing an online reservation system benefit companies?
FAQs.answer: Developing an online reservation experience could lure a larger amount of customers and help lower overall lead times.

FAQs.question: What regulations do companies need to comply with regarding consumer safety?
FAQs.answer: Regulations regarding consumer safety vary between municipalities.

FAQs.question: What labor regulations do companies need to comply with?
FAQs.answer: The industry employs a high number of workers at hourly rates and, therefore, is subject to minimum wage and employee benefits regulations.

FAQs.question: What could lower profit margins compared to competitors suggest?
FAQs.answer: Achieving lower profit margins amid heightened competition suggests that inefficiencies may exist in a company's supply chain in relation to its major competitors.

FAQs.question: How has heightened competition affected industry profit?
FAQs.answer: Heightened competition has put downward pressure on industry profit.

FAQs.question: How can companies compensate for volatility of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Operators experiencing low booking rates during off periods can increase promotional output or offer ancillary services to diversify revenue.

FAQs.question: How can having a high profile location benefit companies?
FAQs.answer: A high profile location that offers easy access and parking can provide a competitive advantage for companies in this industry.

FAQs.question: How can effective product promotion benefit companies?
FAQs.answer: Being able to promote a business effectively increases awareness and attracts greater membership and local patronage.

FAQs.question: How important is having a good reputation for companies?
FAQs.answer: Driving ranges and fun centres often rely on referrals to attract new clientele, so it is important for companies to maintain a high level of service quality and customer satisfaction.

FAQs.question: How do health and fitness clubs offering similar services affect the industry?
FAQs.answer: Health and fitness clubs that provide a multitude of fitness classes (including yoga and Pilates) are excluded from the industry and are considered a source of external competition. Demand for health and fitness clubs is anticipated to rise.

FAQs.question: How does rising unemployment affect the industry?
FAQs.answer: Increases in the national unemployment dampen consumer demand for Pilates and yoga classes, as fewer individuals have the discretionary income required to purchase classes, particularly one-on-one fitness classes.

FAQs.question: How do disposable income levels affect demand for services?
FAQs.answer: As per capita disposable income rises, more individuals will have the financial resources necessary to purchase one-on-one Pilates and yoga classes, as well as classes sold in bundle packages.
